Authors: Zhan Bo Liu, Meng Zhou, Yu Cheng Dai, Yuan Yuan
Title:
Global diversity and taxonomy of Sidera (Hymenochaetales,
Basidiomycota): four new species and keys to species of the genus
Abstract:
The genus Sidera is a polypore genus with resupinate,
white to cream or buff fresh basidioma, poroid or hydnoid hymenophore, a
monomitic or dimitic hyphal system with generative hyphae bearing clamp
connections, the presence of rosette-like crys-tals, and allantoid to
lunate basidiospores. We study the phylogeny and diversity of Sidera
herein by using both morphological and molecular methods. Phylogenetic
anal-yses are based on ITS dataset, the combined 2-gene dataset
(5.8S+nLSU) and 7-gene dataset (ITS+nLSU+RPB1+RPB2+TEF1+mtSSU+nSSU) of
15 taxa of Sidera all over the world. Among these four species are new
to science, viz.Â S. inflata, S. malaysiana, S. punctata and S.
roseo-bubalina. In addition, three taxa are treated as Sidera vulgaris
sensu lato. New species are all described and illustrated. An
identification key to 14 accepted species of Sidera in worldwide is
provided.
